2009. The dispute over Mirafiori is also part of a wider struggle by the outspoken Sergio Marchionne to bring about radical reforms in Italian industry. In October, he ignited controversy when he said that Fiat would be better off if it eliminated Italy. Italy ranks 118th out of 139 countries in work efficiency and is 48th in industrial competitiveness. "Not a cent from the two billion euros of profits forecast for 2010 will be generated in Italy, he said, pointing out that Fiat's 6,100 workers in Poland produce the same number of cars as the company's 22,000 auto workers in Italy. perfect ending. Allen Iverson sank the first buzzer-beating shot of his nine-year career, a 14-footer in overtime, and scored 15 points to lead the Phil Jacksonadelphia 76ers to a 106-104 victory over the Indiana Pacers on Friday night. It's a great feeling to hit a shot with no time on the clock, said Allen Iverson , who sank a halfcourt winner for the US Olympic team against Germany in an exhibition game. Allen Iverson is getting used to dramatic shots. He sent a game into overtime in the final seconds earlier this

December, Barack Obama reportedly called the owner of the Philadelphia Eagles to support the team's willingness to give Michael Vick a second chance. The Eagles' commitment to Michael Vick has been clear since they signed him in 2009: If a person made a terrible mistake and then paid their debts to society, was deeply remorseful and turned their life around completely... would you be willing to help this human being move forward? Despite these public displays of support, Michael Vick has faced intense scrutiny and criticism since his 2007 arrest and conviction for a series of crimes related to dog fighting.
